basics.name: Tsatsu Kofi Amable
basics.label: Software Developer
basics.summary: I am an engineering professional with a sound understanding of relational database technologies and tools in the microsoft office ecosystem. I have experience working with Relational Database Technologies and tools including Microsoft SQL Server, Python, Php, Java, Microsoft Office Access, among others. I have also worked with other technologies, ranging from cloud (Amazon Web Services) to geospatial information systems (GIS), systems administration (Linux & Windows) and content management systems.

location.address: #7 Nana Sika Street, Off Zibra Street, Pokuase Amanfrom

work.summary: Rancard Solutions is a world class technology company with clients in Africa, the Middle East and Europe
highlights: Currently building tools (based on Google Sheets API, Facebook Messenger Bot API and proprietary code bases) for inhouse automated report generation to ease the burden on quality assurance and to improve operational efficiency and quality assurance across all inhouse systems. I am also engaged in additional work using LSTM networks to predict and isolate performance issues in the Rendezvous core platform.
currently engaged in additional work using LSTM networks to predict and isolate performance issues in the Rancard's core platform.

work.summary: Nilout is a engineering contractor start-up that is currently developing tools to make it a technology service provider to a larger market
highlights: I am currently building NilOut's first mass market tool for the creative arts industry based on nodejs + postgres + Vuejs. NilOut hopes to roll the product out across Africa.

work.summary: I have worked on a variety of projects during this period, from Wordpress websites where I built themes from scratch, to software for running a microsavings business in Ada, the South of Ghana with Microsoft Office Access
Intruptive Solutions was a Meltwater Institute of Technology Startup that built an Instagram-esque location-based photo sharing app in 2014
highlights: I developed a dashboard with Java Play framework to enhance reporting on the growth of the platform

work.position: Legacy Tax MIS Maintenance Service Provider
work.summary: GRA is the Government of Ghana's Tax Administration agency.
highlights: I maintained key legacy MIS systems across several offices in the capital for the GRA’s VAT Service during a transition phase to a more robust, nationwide system. Each of the offices run different implementations of a MS Access database, and each had specific needs and use cases that required custom solutions. I would routinely be called in, take the system offline (the network), fix bugs, impliment new solutions and redeploy these systems. These systems held data for all the tax transactions for the Government of Ghana up until the end of 2014.

work.company: College of Basic and Applied Sciences, University of Ghana
work.summary: The College, at the time the Faculty of Science, maintained a computer lab for development and maintenance of software. I was selected by the Computer Science Department to serve myu national service at the College
highlights: I administered and maintained the lab's client server network.
I developed a student registration web application for the faculty with vb.net (asp.net) over MS SQL Server 2005 Enterprise Database Management Tool.
I was also responsible for historical data of over 25,000 students that had been captured and stored over the years.

volunteer.summary: The Akuakuenyehia Foundation is a not for profit organisation founded by the children of H.E. Judge Prof. Akua Kuenyehia, formerly of the International Criminal Court to assist financially constrained young women to pursue their educational/academic dreams
highlights: Held a one-day writing clinic for 15 pre-university women
Was a camp facilitator for a CV clinic, personal pitch and coach for a camp debate team.
